seo_title: Extraordinary Eats Await in Chelsea Market
long_description:
A neighborhood market managed to become one of the top food destinations in New York City—and the world. How did it happen? Who’s to receive a standing ovation? And why is Chelsea Market such a hit? The Royalton New York Hotel has the scoop.

 

Now a quintessential part of Chelsea’s many perks, Chelsea Market began as part of the National Biscuit Company, more commonly known as Nabisco. In the late 19th Century and part of the 20th Century, the complex was nothing more than a factory. However, the company moved out in 1959 and the building remained forgotten until it was bought in 1990. Chelsea Market was inaugurated in 1997, with much of its original structure, brick walls and Nabisco murals intact. This unpolished, urban look worked-people began flocking to the newly opened food shops and stores.

Over the years, Chelsea Market has gained a reputation as a gourmet food paradise where one can spend an entire day sampling a little bit of this and that. You’ll find lobster, a milk bar, specialty tea and coffee shops, all sorts of pastries,  wine, beer, spirits, gelatos, cuisine from all over the world and plenty more restaurants to choose from. If you need a break from eating, peruse one of the many stores and boutiques scattered throughout the complex.



Chelsea Market Information

Hours: Monday - Saturday: 7am to 2am, Sunday: 8am to 10pm
Address: 75 9th Avenue, between 15th and 16 Streets, New York, NY 10011


If you’re a regular at the Royalton New York Hotel, you already know that we’re just a short taxi or subway ride from Chelsea. If this is your first time staying with us, check out our special offers and allow us to welcome you and show you this and other incredible sights in New York—and the Royalton is one of them!
